articles.description: An at-home DNA test given as a birthday gift solved an 80-year family mystery by revealing that a man in Quebec and a man in the Netherlands were long-lost brothers.

articles.title: Raptors fall to Lakers on Hachimura buzzer-beater; LeBron point streak comes to an end
articles.description: Austin Reaves scored 44 points, and Rui Hachimura hit a buzzer-beating three-pointer as the Los Angeles Lakers beat the Toronto Raptors 123-120 on Thursday. Reaves had 11 assists and five rebounds for the Lakers (16-5), who were without superstar point guard Luka Doncic, who didn’t travel to T

articles.title: Hachimura’s three lifts Lakers over Raptors
articles.description: Austin Reaves scored 44 points and Rui Hachimura hit a buzzer-beating three-pointer as the Los Angeles Lakers beat the Toronto Raptors 123-120 on Thursday.

articles.title: Slower Philippines Inflation Supports Another Rate Cut
articles.description: Philippine inflation slowed in November, supporting another cut in the central bank’s benchmark interest rate next week as a graft scandal hits consumer and investor confidence.

articles.title: Takeaways: Ottawa Senators finish without Shane Pinto in loss to New York Rangers
articles.description: "He's a big loss," said coach Travis Green. "Pinto plays a lot of important minutes."

articles.title: Levi Verch, Levi Anderson sharing more than a name with Saskatchewan Rush
articles.description: Levi Verch and Levi Anderson made waves in the NCAA ranks at St. Joseph's University and are now teammates again, bringing the physicality with the Saskatchewan Rush.

articles.title: Rogers Charity Classic tees off giving season with record-setting charity donation
articles.description: The Rogers Charity Classic has kicked off giving season by raising a record-setting $26 million this summer for local charities, including Brown Bagging for Calgary’s Kids. The annual summer golf tournament brought together professional golfers, community leaders, and volunteers in support of youth-

articles.title: Maple Leafs extend winning streak to 3, lose goaltender Woll to injury
articles.description: Bobby McMann opened and closed the scoring while Matthew Knies had a goal and an assist as the Toronto Maple Leafs extended their winning streak to three games with a 5-1 win over the Carolina Hurricanes on Thursday night. Auston Matthews and Scott Laughton also scored for Toronto, who have won four

articles.title: Montreal artist brings tale of grief and loss to stage: ‘Un-nevering’
articles.description: Montreal-based dancer and choreographer Thea Patterson is exploring the themes of loss and grief through the art of performance for a special showing at Espace Libre. In a show entitled “Un-Nevering” Patterson joins with two friends and collaborators to address her loss and journey of grief followin

articles.title: Stellantis Get Canada Default Notice After Moving Jeep Line to US
articles.description: The Canadian government told Stellantis NV it’s in default on its taxpayer-backed financial aid after it moved auto production to a US plant, Industry Minister Melanie Joly said.

articles.title: OpenAI, NextDC Plan to Build $4.6 Billion Sydney Data Center
articles.description: OpenAI partnered with Australian data center operator NextDC Ltd. to build a A$7 billion ($4.6 billion) large-scale computing cluster in Sydney, accelerating its expansion in the Asia-Pacific region.

articles.title: RCMP investigating after several pedestrians hit in Port Coquitlam crash
articles.description: The RCMP says it is investigating after several pedestrians were hit in a multi-vehicle crash in Port Coquitlam earlier this week.

articles.title: Texas can use GOP-drawn voting map for 2026 midterm elections: U.S. Supreme Court
articles.description: The justices lifted a lower court ruling that had blocked the map, which was drawn at Trump’s behest to help Republicans try to keep their House majority

articles.title: Trump administration to direct more water to California farms
articles.description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) — The Trump administration is making good on a promise to send more water to California farmers in the state’s crop-rich Central Valley. articles.title: Saskatchewan’s Birdsall, Ziebart making history in Women’s Pro Baseball League
articles.description: Selected in the inaugural Women's Pro Baseball League Draft, Braidy Birdsall and Addie Ziebart are chasing professional opportunities not seen in decades for Saskatchewan players.

articles.title: Edmonton City Council sets property tax to 6.9%
articles.description: The City Council approved an increase in property tax to 6.9 per cent in a Fall Budget Adjustment vote Thursday. articles.title: Pattullo Bridge to close southbound for several hours starting Thursday evening
articles.description: The Pattullo Bridge, connecting Surrey and New Westminster, is closing southbound starting at 9 p.m. Thursday.

articles.description: On December 4, WIRED sat down with some of the biggest names in tech, culture, business, and science for a day full of in-depth interviews.

articles.description: George Foote, who served as the outside general counsel to the US Institute of Peace, said at WIRED’s Big Interview event that DOGE operatives arrived like a “strike team.”

articles.title: US Supreme Court allows Texas to use redrawn district map for 2026 midterms
articles.description: The new Texas map, backed by Donald Trump, has sparked similar efforts for partisan redistricting across the US.
